title: FOster the Comprehension and USe of Knowledge intensive technologies for coding and sharing 3D media content

author: Michela Spagnuolo, Institute for Applied Mathematics and Information Technologies, Department of Genoa

segmentation: So first of all, just a little introduction, which is the main difference between 3D media 3D content and what we heard until now so.
Today Media suffers of the semantic gap for sure, but partially this is due also to the sensory gap that we face when acquiring data in.
Image or video form.
What we have the advantage of 3D media 3D media are 3D representation.
Complete representation of objects, items that you can think of.

So what we have in more with respect to the traditional multimedia is a complete description of objects so we don't need to take care about the segmentation and reconstruction part because the geometry is given.
So this in some some sense.
Is an advantage it poses other kinds of problems, so 3D means that we move from pixel based domain to vector based modeling of objects.

With this premise, so the Focus K3D project started at March this year, so we are rather at the beginning for it will last for two years and this project, coordinated by Yankovic again of our Institute, the CNR Institute of Applied Mathematics in.
These are the partners of the projects of the project.
Most of them are present here in the room, so we have the imarti CNR the area.
Sophia Antipolis, the University of who tracked in the Netherlands the throne, offer in damaged at the SINTEF, Norway.
We have the University of Geneva and the EPS fell in Switzerland and the terror attack.
English.
This is the main, uh, the goal.
The objective of the project.
What we want to do is to bring the paradigm of semantic multimedia from multimedia to the 3D context.
And we want to we have.
Our goal is to promote the adoption of what we call knowledge technologies.
This can be semantic annotation.
It can be structured metadata for storing and sharing 3D shapes.
Content based retrieval system shape similarity reasoning on 3D objects in this scene in what we call shape intensive application and you will see a very nice example of this in the.
Following presentations, so as I said before here, the type of content that you are dealing with is 3D media, 3D shapes or 3D content.

As you refer to to name it, 3D shapes may be created either by design, so I think for example of tools like second life tools for modeling 3D shapes offered by Second Life for the Nice Sport game that is out in these days.
So the user creates a shape which doesn't actually exist in the physical world.
It's just in the vehicle.
Domain in there.
The space or it can be created by acquisition, so we have an object in the physical space we want to create a digital counterpart.
What is really important to notice is that in the last decade we assisted, really took great improvement of technology which makes feasible nowadays to use, produce and share 3D media in.
Let me say cost less manner compared to what was at the very beginning.
So what we have now is that at the beginning actually rendering 3D models was a possible only on high-end graphics station like the Silicon Graphics or similar.
Now we can have really beautiful and accurate 3D models on the desktop at the same time.

Also the acquisition devices and I'm speaking about laser scanning, but also about photogrammetry ever reached really leveling at which each lab can be equipped with a laser scanner for very few amount of money.
I've seen recently a little portable scanner which cost something around 200 euros and.
It takes 3D pictures, 3D images, and models of objects that are a solution of 0.3 centimeters, which is something very very nice for a number of application.
Computer networks now we have broadband we can share in stream 3D models without any real problem and now what we have seen or so recently is the also 3D printers that are now very very nice.
You can disclose somehow the cycle of the life cycle of 3D shapes.
So you can create your 3D model.
You can stream process manipulated and you could even rematerialize it with a 3D printer.
With the material, the properties that you wish.
So this makes possible to think of 3D really in a in an UN very creative manner.

Also on the other side, thanks to this advance and then advances what we have seen is that in many scientific scientific fields we we have a shift of paradigm from what was physical experiment to what is now virtual prototypes and simulation.
So also in many scientific fields the use of digital data digital 3D data.
Is becoming really the way to to do science to do research?
And this can be seen in domains like the cut, manufacturing domain, the bioinformatics cultural heritage.
You will see this in details later.
So in this sense 3D content or shape model can be seen as a generalized concept which encloses content provided by user, but also scientific scientific content.
So in this sense, what is the view and what is the perspective?
Of the Focus K3D pro project.
While the visualization is for sure, the key way to approach with 3D content.
As for multimedia, we want to see it so 3D content is typically a visual appearance of visual characteristic and visualization is the basic way to approach with them.
But there is much more.
3D content is not only the visualization visualization of the shape represented, but we should also reason in terms of what we've heard before.
What is the semantics of 3D models?
What is their meaning?
What is their function?
Can we make 3D shapes more intelligent?
For example to make them reactive to the environment in which they are placed in which are designed?
What I mean is, for example, if I have a digital model of a mic and I'm a virtual character in Avatar, can I automatically grasp the mic in the right position?
Can we add to the digital model of the mic some intelligence so that if I interact with it?
I don't have to make specific programs for that.
What and this is very crucial, especially in scientific domains?
What are the workflows?

The scientific workflows that are used to manipulate the process to analyze this content so when we speak about knowledge in focus K3D about 3D shapes, we actually mean many, many different types of knowledge or semantics.
Knowledge about the model, knowledge about the context in which the models are used, knowledge of the user that uses the model.
So focus K3D builds actually on the results of the previous initiative, which is aimed at shape.

It was a network of excellence which lasted for four years, and it was the first project that was trying to bring 3D in the multimedia scenario we have developed infrastructure for sharing 3D shapes with ontology driven metadata.
We have developed in this project also a semantic search engine and the geometric search engine which allows the user to.
Browse and retrieve 3D shapes according to knowledge of the domain or shape similarity.
Which is a very nice idea.

The goals of the project itself is to try to now work more closely with application that are using 3D media, so we want to go closer to the application domain and if anyone of you is interested in joining the activities, please leave your business card or contact us.
We are open to in our coordination action to anyone who wants to collaborate.
So the main.

The achievements that we're trying to push her to try to assess the current state of the art of the use of 3D and knowledge in application domain and together with you and with the participants to draft what can be the research route Maps for 3D semantic.
Media.
So I the project itself is organized in application working groups.
You will see the presentation of them later on and a methodological working group which tries to summarize and wrap up the outcomes of the PLLC.
Asian working groups.
I don't say anything about this.
You will.
It later, what are the target user that we are considering so professional?
This is to summarize, professional developers, creators of digital content which can be also normal users or professional scientists and dealers of three depositers.
There are many many many dealers of 3D repository's.
Just Google on.
On the web three depository.
You will see how many.
Of them there are.
And the activities of the projects are mainly promoting workshop adopt meeting with users in the application domain.
We have done a first round of questionnaire sending around question or to the application people to see what is their perspective.
What is their use of 3D and knowledge and you will see some preliminary highlights on the results of this question are so this is.
Then this is the portal address of our project.
Ever look at is the register.
Download the newsletter.
Some of them are also here and these are the closest events that will be promoted by by our project.
So for me, it's over.
